I don't believe the fate of the protagonist can really be discribed as something ultimatly cruel. He was unfit for society barely scratching the buttom of the 100 points. A live of constant fear and doubts. Fear can eat souls. A person bound by consideration and reservation can't move on. Now he might live a life of agony and temporary torture but at least he has found his place in society. In same way it's like the work "Drop out" by Fan no hitori, only difference is that the protagonist has to be a little bit forced for his happiness. Well, well, what a twisted fate.

LIFE-IS-A-CHEMICAL-REACTION: Interresting interpretation. The easist way to create equality in one group, is by discriminating others. The feeling of supremacy indequently from the system it applies to, can unite people in complacment. Now some might argue that this might be a bad case, or perhaps not? Through out human history humanity never existed as entity only as little groups trying to survive and satisfying there needs. Currently the aspect of survival has vanished in most society's, still the need of satisfication remains. Therefore people still are searching for victims in order to satisfy there more primordial/dark urges (naive people would call it evil, excuse me I am an Nietzschean). And as the can't turn against there own group members, they turn against weaker groups. And if one group for what reason ever, breaks down to them, the cycle of dual counter-traits is set into motion.

Oh and Darkgod47:  My father was murdered years ago and I'm sure some other people here have lost their parents too.  Please try to contain your attempt at viral message passing.  Chain letters were never funny to begin with- just an illustration of how easily humans fall prey to authoritative thinking, indoctrination, and magickal thinking / superstition.  You just read an intriguing (if not horrific) plotline-   why not discuss that?
'

Box94 connected the dots.  Much like Orwell's 1984, this is a social commentary about the banality of evil.  Except in this case, its also the anal-ity of evil.  Whether its "Godless Communism" or  a Free Market+monotheism, there are always some people stepping on other people for their own enjoyment .  It is an evolutionary adaptation (or side effect of one). Almost all evolved traits have dual counter-traits; like opposing muscles..  Masochism is the opposing force to sadism; its a shame there aren't more switches out there who recognize both as a sort of theatric representation of our primal archetypes.    You can view them as defense mechanisms against the disappointment/disillusionment of finding oneself romantically unfulfilled  as compared to what we see portrayed in by movies, etc.  A callback to simpler times, when consent wasn't highly regarded.
